findings.title: Permissioned roles concentrate a lot of privileges
findings.description: The Props protocol implementation assigns key privileges to certain roles, including `controller`, `admin`, and `guardian`. This introduces a certain degree of centralization, which may be a security risk in the case of key compromise.

findings.title: Divisions before multiplication lead to decreased precision
findings.description: Performing integer divisions before multiplications in calculations can lead to decreased precision.

findings.title: PropsProtocol.sol: stakeAsDelegate() will always fail for unstaking
findings.description: The `stakeAsDelegate()` function will always revert in `_stake()` when unstaking, due to the check `require(_msgSender() == _from, "Unauthorized");`.

findings.title: PropsProtocol.sol: transferGuardianship() and transferControl() lag zero checks
findings.description: The `transferGuardianship()` and `transferControl()` functions allow `address(0)` as parameters. However, renouncing these roles in the current implementation would break the protocol.

findings.title: Timelock.sol: Pausing of contract cannot be undone
findings.description: The `TimeLock` contract can only be stopped by the pause function and there is no `unpause()` equivalent to enable the contract again, which means that once paused the time locking functionality will be disabled forever.

findings.title: Staking.sol: Not all parameter changes are covered by events
findings.description: In some cases, key protocol parameters can be changed without an event being emitted. It is best practice to emit events in such cases consistently to allow off-chain protocol monitoring.

findings.title: SPropsToken.sol: Domain separator could be precalculated to safe gas
findings.description: The `domainSeparator` used in `delegateBySig()` could be precalculated in the initializer to reduce gas costs.

findings.title: SPropsToken.sol: approve() should revert if transfers are not allowed
findings.description: The `approve()` function is implemented despite transfers not being allowed, which is inconsistent with expected behavior.
